title: 107_s1058
content: The Act may be cited as the "Biodiesel Renewable Fuels Act" and includes an amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding a credit for biodiesel used as fuel. The "Biodiesel Renewable Fuels Act" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a biodiesel fuels credit based on the biodiesel mixture rate and the number of gallons of qualified biodiesel mixture used by a taxpayer in a taxable year. The biodiesel fuels credit for any taxpayer in a taxable year is calculated by multiplying the biodiesel mixture rate for each blend by the number of gallons of the blend used by the taxpayer. The biodiesel mixture rate varies depending on the blend, with rates of 3.0 cents for a B-2 blend and 20.0 cents for a B-20 blend. The biodiesel fuels credit rates vary for different blends: 3.0 cents for a B-2 blend and 20.0 cents for a B-20 blend. The terms B-1, B-2, and B-20 blends are defined based on the percentage of biodiesel in the mixture. The terms B-2 and B-20 blends are defined based on the percentage of biodiesel in the mixture, with B-2 containing at least 2.0 percent but less than 20 percent biodiesel, and B-20 containing at least 20 percent biodiesel. The term 'applicable amount' is used to determine the percentage of biodiesel in the mixture for qualifying as a biodiesel blend. A qualified biodiesel mixture contains at least 20 percent biodiesel. The 'applicable amount' is calculated based on the percentage of biodiesel in the blend. A qualified biodiesel mixture contains at least 20 percent biodiesel and is sold or used as a fuel in a trade or business. The applicable amount is calculated based on the percentage of biodiesel in the blend, with a denominator of 1 percent. The credit for biodiesel used in qualified mixtures is only allowed for sales or use in the taxpayer's trade or business for the taxable year. Casual off-farm production is not eligible for this credit. The credit for biodiesel in qualified mixtures is only allowed for sales or use in the taxpayer's trade or business for the taxable year. Casual off-farm production is not eligible for this credit. The amount of the credit may be reduced to account for any benefit provided by the application of certain sections. The credit for biodiesel is reduced to account for benefits from specific sections. Biodiesel is defined as monoalkyl esters of long chain fatty acids from vegetable oils for use in diesel engines. The term 'biodiesel' refers to monoalkyl esters of long chain fatty acids from various vegetable oils for use in diesel engines, including oils from corn, soybeans, sunflower seeds, cottonseeds, canola, crambe, rapeseeds, safflowers, flaxseeds, and mustard seeds. Registration requirements must be met for biodiesel to be included as a fuel or fuel additive. The term 'biodiesel' includes oils from various vegetable sources like corn, soybeans, sunflower seeds, and canola. Biodiesel must meet EPA registration requirements under the Clean Air Act. If biodiesel is used in a qualified biodiesel mixture, a tax may be imposed. If biodiesel is separated from a qualified biodiesel mixture or used for purposes other than fuel, a tax will be imposed on the person responsible. A tax is imposed on a person who uses a biodiesel mixture other than as fuel, based on the biodiesel mixture rate and the number of gallons used. Applicable laws and penalties apply to this tax. A taxpayer may elect to have the biodiesel fuels credit not apply for any taxable year. Regulations similar to those of section 52 shall apply in the case of estates and trusts. The rules of subsection (d) of section 52 apply. A taxpayer can elect to have the biodiesel fuels credit not apply for any taxable year, with the election to be made before the expiration of the 3-year period from the last date for filing the return. The biodiesel fuels credit election must be made by the last date for filing the return, as prescribed by the Secretary. This credit is treated as part of the general business credit under section 38(b), with specific amendments made to include it. The biodiesel fuels credit election must be made by the last date for filing the return. Amendments are made to include it as part of the general business credit under section 38(b). Additionally, there are conforming amendments related to the biodiesel fuels credit determined under section 40A. The biodiesel fuels credit under section 40A can be carried back to a taxable year before January 1, 2003. Section 196(c) is amended to include the biodiesel fuels credit. Amendments are made to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. The amendments made by section 40A regarding biodiesel fuel apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2001. Additionally, there is a reduction in motor fuel excise taxes on biodiesel mixtures. The tax rate for qualified biodiesel mixtures is reduced under new regulations by the Secretary. Diesel fuel used in producing biodiesel is also subject to tax reductions. The tax rate for biodiesel mixtures is reduced when diesel fuel is used to produce qualified biodiesel mixtures. The tax rate for biodiesel mixtures is reduced based on the biodiesel mixture rate and the percentage of biodiesel in the mixture. Definitions in this subsection align with those in section 40A. The tax rate for biodiesel mixtures is reduced based on the biodiesel mixture rate and the percentage of biodiesel in the mixture. Definitions align with those in section 40A, and certain rules apply for this subsection. Amendments are made to section 4041 regarding qualified biodiesel. Amendments are made to sections 4041 and 6427 regarding the tax rates for qualified biodiesel mixtures. The rates are reduced based on the biodiesel mixture rate defined in section 40A. Amendments to sections 4041 and 6427 reduce tax rates for qualified biodiesel mixtures based on the biodiesel mixture rate defined in section 40A. If diesel fuel is used to produce a qualified biodiesel mixture sold or used in a trade or business, the Secretary will pay the person an amount per gallon. The amendments reduce tax rates for qualified biodiesel mixtures based on the biodiesel mixture rate. If used in producing and selling biodiesel mixtures, the Secretary will pay an amount per gallon. Effective January 1, 2002. SEC. 4. HIGHWAY TRUST FUND HELD HARMLESS. Transfers from Commodity Credit Corporation funds to Highway Trust Fund to offset reductions in receipts due to amendments made by the Act. Transfers based on Treasury Secretary's estimates with adjustments for errors.
